intro: Crantziola carolinensis, commonly known as the Carolina crantziola, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and wetlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
